column1: Online TransactionPay Online   Link to External Website
M60 Invest
The opening of the M60 and the development of Ashton Moss have changed the face of Tameside and have opened up new opportunities in this area
Details and map of M60 Manchester Outer Ring Road
Manchester Airport
Portrays the regiment against the social and industrial history of the times
Access to map-based information for the Borough of Tameside
For the latest press release issues or to use the electronic form to make press enquiries
<li class="a2z_pt" title="Online Transaction and Payment available">
For information on all the local market grounds, including opening times, stall hire costs and bookings etc.
For advice, appointment bookings and to apply and pay on-line for a copy marriage certificate
The Marriages (Approved Premises) Regulations 1995 allow civil marriages to take place regularly in hotels, stately homes, civic halls and similar premises
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Martial Arts clubs within the Borough.
Details about the Mayor, who for 2006/2007, is Councillor Margaret Sidebottom
<li class="a2z_pt" title="Online Transaction and Payment available">
Around 4,500 meals are delivered each week to housebound people.
Medals, Honours and Titles
Information from DirectGov on the UK system of honours and medals and on how to nominate someone for an honour.
Tameside now has 10 MEP's - constituencies were changed for the 1999 European Parliamentary Elections where MEP's were elected by the proportional representation system.
Tameside has three MPs that serve the area they are; Andrew Gwynne, James Purnell and David Heyes. You can also write to your MP at House of Commons, London SW1A 0AA or telephone 0207 219 3000
More information on mental health issues
A guide to getting extra help and support with employment if you have a disability or mental health' illness. Now known as Routes to Work
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Metal Detecting clubs within the Borough.
Links to the community database holding details of Methodist Churches within the Borough
Tameside Council has joined forces with the local press to launch a campaign to bring the Phase 3 Metrolink plans back on track
Local newspapers, census records, parish records etc. are held on microfiche at the Local Studies Library in Stalybridge
The coal industry in Tameside was at its height in the mid 18th century
Information for Health and Social Care Workers on how Tameside Social Care and Health is supporting the cultural and language needs of these communities.

Have you got money problems? Confused by all the adverts offering loans? Baffled by the small print? Don't know where to get the right advice? MINT has been set up by a number of organisations in the Tameside area. These range from having access to the right type of financial services or to courses which can help people manage their money.
Providing Information on what to do and related links.(Last updated: 11-Apr-2006)
<li class="a2z_pt" title="Online Transaction and Payment available">
Mobile Warden Service (known as the Community Response Service)

Help is on hand 24 hours a day at the touch of a button. The Tameside Community Alarm Service is linked to the council's new call centre and mobile warden service. Available to anyone living in Tameside
The Council runs a Modern Apprenticeship scheme for Young People (under 21 when they start). This normally starts in March, with successful applicants starting work in July
Modernising local government in Tameside. This part of our website aims to give you an idea of how the Council is changing
Links to the community database holding details of Moravian Churches within the Borough
Links to the community database holding details of Mosques within the Borough
Includes places of interest and facts about the town
Links to the community database holding details of independently run Motorcycle clubs within the Borough.
Information on taxing and registering a vehicle, driving licences, abandoned and untaxed vehicles and the Council's Surrender Scheme
information about the M60 Manchester Outer Ring Road
Moving home can be a stressful time - we've gathered together some information plus an on-line form to notify us of your change of address

Providing instrumental tuition and music ensembles for pupils. The unit is based at Festival Hall, Denton, telephone 0161 320 4246 for further details. More details on Remission of Music Tuition Charges
Tameside has 3 museums - Portland Basin Museum and the Museum of the Manchesters plus Setantii, an exciting new visitor attraction
Portrays the regiment against the social and industrial history of the times
